description: Numbers with multiplicative digital root value 5.
comments: All digits of a(n) must be odd. - _Robert Israel_, Oct 19 2015
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Multiplicative Digital Root
maple: mdr:= proc(n) option remember;if n < 10 then return(n) fi;procname(convert(convert(n,base,10),`*`))end proc:select(mdr=5, [$1..10^5]); # _Robert Israel_, Oct 19 2015
prog: (PARI) t(n) = {while(n>9, n=prod(i=1, #n=digits(n), n[i])); n};for(n=0, 1e4, if(t(n) == 5, print1(n", "))); \\ _Altug Alkan_, Oct 19 2015
crossrefs: Cf. A034048, A002275, A034049, A034050, A034051, A034052, A034053, A034054, A034055, A034056 (numbers having multiplicative digital roots 0-9).
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Sep 15 1998
extensions: Incorrect formula removed by _Martin Renner_, Oct 19 2015
